title: The Walking Dead's Norman Reedus and ex get soppy on son's birthday
text:
Norman Reedus and ex Helena Christensen get soppy on son’s 20th birthday (Picture: helenachristensen / Instagram)

The Walking Dead star Norman Reedus and his former partner Helena Christensen have wished their son a happy birthday.

Taking to Instagram, the proud parents shared a string of pictures of their bambino, Mingus Lucien Reedus, who turned 20 over the weekend.

And it didn’t take long for them to write all the gushy captions.

Posting a number of heart emojis, the Daryl Dixon star wrote: ‘Happy birthday to the coolest of all time.’

And his ex shared the same sentiment, as she too told her 598,000 followers just how much she loved her son.

‘Today is a beautiful day because you were born, 20 years ago! Love you so much,’ the Danish model wrote.

They called him one cool kid (Picture: helenachristensen)

Fans were quick to comment on their snaps with a flurry of well wishes to the young star.

‘Happy birthday sir you have the coolest pops there is,’ one wrote while another added: ‘Fine looking young man Norman!!!’

Someone else said: ‘Happy birthday Mingus. He is a Mini Norman.’

As well as Mingus, the actor shares almost one-year-old tot with his girlfriend Diane Kruger, who they welcomed into the world back in November last year.

The famous pair have been careful to shield their little one from the public eye and have only sparingly shared her image to social media making sure her face is always covered.

View this post on Instagram A post shared by Diane Kruger (@dianekruger) on Aug 16, 2019 at 4:24am PDT

However, one image of the little one made it onto social media, sparking the protective mum to plea with her fans not to share images.

‘While we understand that some people would like to see a picture of our daughter, we as parents, want nothing more than allow her to grow up in privacy and safety,’ Diane previously explained.

‘Me and @bigbaldhead [Norman] would kindly ask you to not repost these pictures and help us achieve that goal. Whoever has already posted them, please take them down.’

She added: ‘Please put yourself in our shoes. We are just like any parent wanting the very best for our child. Thank you for your support.’

Following this, the star decided to treat her followers to a glimpse at her family life, as she shared a picture of her daughter staring into the sunset on Mother’s Day.

The 43-year-old wrote: ‘I love you forever. I’ll like you for always. As long as I’m living, my baby you will be.’
